result.execSummary:
The defendant August M. Fetting was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit DNA and pay surcharge.  Bond on file to be applied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. August M. Fetting

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant August M. Fetting in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Zamzow; the matter is resolved today.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Zamzow agrees.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.    
Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Zamzow states that there is one day credit.

BY THE COURT:  Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
bond to be applied
Return date on November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant August M. Fetting in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant wants to get a public defender.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
